title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq losing 0.2% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Dow shed less than 0.1%, but all three held on to weekly gains.

NFL viewership is at its highest level in six years, an increase media executives attribute to competitive matchups and the return of spectators.

Apple told a federal judge that it plans to appeal a verdict in its high-profile antitrust case against Epic Games.

Food-delivery giant Meituan was fined more than $533 million by China for engaging in anticompetitive practices.

Facebook said some users had trouble accessing its products on Friday, a disruption that followed an hourslong outage earlier in the week.

What's News: Business & Finance
